characters: IN A TRUCK DOWN THE STREET
MARIACHI ON THE ROAD TO MOCO'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an early Friday morning and a patrol car drives up a unpaved road and parks next to a gutted police car on cin blocks. The camera pans with the OFFICER as he exits his and walks up to a ramp leading to the baby blue JAIL HOUS He is carrying a greasy bag of fast food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer enters the lobby, tosses the bag of food to h PARTNER who is sitting at a desk. He grabs a tin cup and  walks over to barred entrance to Block A. Twenty or so  CRIMINALS, from drunks to drug dealers are sleeping peace in their cell on Block A. The Officer rattles the tin cup between the entrance bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inmates stir, rubbing their dirty faces and trying to sit up. The camera dollies slowly down the narrow hallway the block which has three cells: Two small ones side by s and one bigger cell that faces the block entrance. The so of scribbling and business dealing can be heard from insi the cell. It is AZUL jotting into a business ledger while chatting on his cellular phone. His cell is equipped with small desk and a refrigerator. He hangs up the phone and  continues writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer with the tin cup sits in a couch across from partner, who is now eating, and reads a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul picks up his phone and makes another call. He talks  business. In the other cell, prisoners are getting up and looking around. Azul hangs up the phone and writes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous, bikini-clad BABE struts slowly into a tightly framed glamour shot. She pauses, takes a deep breath, the dives a 'perfect ten' dive into a house-side moat. She sw long, slow motion strokes around the moat as the camera t alongside her, lovingly admiring her tan lines and  hydrodynamic build. She slides out of the water and walks a cobble stone walk, dripping as she passes a seated GENT in a white suit. His face is unrevealed. As she enters th house, he sets his drink down by a phone. He lifts up the receiver and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul's phone rings. He looks up at it, startled, as if no one has ever called him before. He glances at his watch, then back at the phone, hesitating to answer it. He looks around the cell block as if someone might be playing a tr on him. Finally he answers it, pausing before saying hell It is El Moco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Azul. Do you know who  this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Moco... What the hell do you want  after all these years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOCO is sitting on his porch drinking tequila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) We've got a lot to talk about. I'm  just a few town away with a whole  new gang. I heard you were nearby so  I thought I'd give you a call, amigo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sweet of you, asshole. I don't  suppose you could get me out of there,  and then maybe hand me over my share  of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes, I figured you'd want your money,  my friend. That is why I have called  you. I heard you were getting out  soon, and figured I should deal with  our situation. But do you really  need me to help you get out? From  what I hear, you're running quite a  business out of your cell with a  phone and some loyal men. It keeps  you well protected I hear. Not a bad  idea. I may try that myself sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could stay in here and earn peanuts  compared to what you owe me if I  were to get out. So, yes, I want you  to help me... my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Soon my friend, soon. I'm sending  you some people in a few days to get  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Well, that's more like it.  Just like the Moco I used to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul is walking towards his window at the sound of a truc racing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Just hang in there my friend. I won't  forget that you have been a big part  of our success. What's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large truck drives up to the jail, parking beside the p car. Two tall, well-dressed MEN step out. They reach into the cab and pull out machine guns. They walk briskly towa the jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul walks to his toilet and stands on it to see out his  barred window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) There's something going on outside.  Is this a double surprise? Are you  getting me out today, Moco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no response from Moco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard reading the magazine stands when he sees someon approaching the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close tracking shot of guns as Tall Men open the door and enter the jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul looks out of the jail cell suspiciously. Peering dow the hall, he sees the guys with the guns. He hides behind the wall, peering out to see what happens next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall Men walk right up to the guard, and hand him a h wad of money. The Guard tosses the money to his partner ( eating), then turns to unlock the block entrance bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul puts the receiver back up to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) There are two men here with guns.  Did you send them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moco, glancing at his watch, hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul hangs up the phone and kicks his Bodyguard awake. Th Bodyguard gets up and peers out the bars as Azul hides in corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall Men walk steady and alert, ready to kill. They e Azul's block and scope out the cells. The Bodyguard, seeing the tall men, retrieves his shotgun from under his mattress and grabs his machete from under sink. He stands ready to fight. The Tall Men move slowly towards the big cell, somewhat  cautious. They see the Bodyguard a second too late, for h sticks the shotgun between the bars, and shoots one of th before they can react. The shot one stumbles back into hi buddy's arms. Azul's Bodyguard, amused by all this, opens his cell door effortlessly, and walks out as if to greet  them. The Tall Men hear the sound of the other cells open so they turn around. The other prisoners on the block beg exiting their cells, carrying guns and Molotov cocktails. The Tall Man drops his gun. Finally, Azul exits his cell  carrying his phone. The Bodyguard forces the Tall Men int an empty cell, closing and locking the door. Azul presses the #-button on his phone. Moco's phone numb is automatically redialed. Moco answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I'm still here, Moco. And so are  your little friends. But not for  long. They have something they want  to scream to you. Listen close,  because you're going to repeat it to  me when I come to visit you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cellmates throw their Molotov cocktails into the cell Moco hears the men screaming as they burn to death. Azul holding the phone at arm's length into the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards exchange glances when they hear the screaming, they smile and shrug, then go back to what they were doin As Azul and his Bodyguards exit the block, the Guard with the magazine stands up as if to stop them, but Azul tosse him a wad of money and the guard sits back down to count

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blue truck races towards the jail. Azul exits the jail carrying a shotgun. His Bodyguards ge inside the Tall Men's truck and start it. Azul waits pati for his blue truck. As the blue truck pulls up, two little rat-like VATOS exi the blue truck, one handing Azul a guitar case. Azul toss it onto the hood. The Bodyguards wave as they drive away. Azul waves back. He opens the case, revealing an arsenal weaponry. Azul notices one piece is missing. One Rat quic pulls the missing weapon from his jacket and replaces it the case. Azul is unamused. He grabs his MAC-10 machine g from the guitar case and aims it at the thieving Rat's he Suddenly, the Guard bolts out the jail waving the wad of  money, as if complaining. Azul turns his MAC-10 onto the Guard instead. A few blast later Azul and his rats pack up and go as the Guard twitc helplessly on the ground, still clutching the money in hi bloody hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue truck barrels down the highway and the camera pa with the truck as it passes a hitchhiker, MARIACHI, stand in the sun with a thumb in the air. The truck passes him so he continues walking. Mariachi is carrying a guitar ca in one hand and a black jacket in the other. He is wearin white T-shirt, black pants. The camera pans to a sign tha reads "ACU?A 18 miles".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is walking around downtown Acu?a. He notices a b across the street and, liking the way it looks, he puts o his jacket and crosses over to it. He stops to read a sig on the building that says "MEMBERS AND NON-MEMBERS ONLY". prays silently to himself before confidently walking insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi enters the club, greeting the PATRONS as he make his way to the bar. No one seems to greet him back. He si on a barstool near some OTHER DRINKERS, laying his guitar case down lovingly beneath his stool. He looks around the place, as if sizing it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Refresco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other drinkers stare at him. Glancing around the room, Mariachi notices a small, table shaped object draped with a cloth in one corner of the ro Sitting directly behind him are four mean-looking dudes.  Mariachi is served his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No hay musica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cleaning a glass) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a mariachi. A good one. I play  beautiful ballads, old classic  ballads, on an old-fashioned guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could add a little class to this  place. I work for fairly cheap, I  live mostly off tips. But I need  steady work, and I can guarantee  bringing in more customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Tell me, why would I need one little  guitar player when I've already got  a full band?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi gives him a silent "what" look. The BARTENDER motions to a YOUNG MAN sitting near the sma draped table. The Young Man removes the drape revealing a keyboard. Put on his mariachi hat, dips his fingers into his shot glass and rubs his fingers together (as if warming up for the b show). He hits a few switches in EXTREME CLOSEUP as... ...Mariachi adjusts himself to the seat. The Young Men gently taps one switch and the keyboard sou like an accordion, pulsing out a beat. He then presses an switch and a horn section swells to a crescendo and waltz the familiar riffs. He adds the string and horns accents banging on the keys. He sounds awful. Mariachi grimaces slightly then turns back to the Bartend who seems to enjoy it. The Keyboard Mariachi finishes his song, sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding with  satisfaction) There you see? Either I can pay one  guy to sound like a full mariachi  band...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi picks up his guitar and lays some money next to full drink. He looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...or I could spend the same money  only get one little guitar player...  Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking away) Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to earn a living? Get a  real musical instrument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender picks up the bottle of soda pop Mariachi le behind and offers it to the other men on the table. They no, pay, and leave. The Bartender offers it to the MEAN D at the table. They all shake their heads no. The Bartender shrugs and dumps it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi walks out and looks up and down the street. He  decides to walk south. As he walks down the sidewalk, the camera pans into a CLO of another guitar case that is moving towards the Corona  Club. The camera falls back a little revealing the backsi of Azul, dressed also in black. Azul walks into the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul enters the bar, notices to his left the table with t four mean-looking Dudes, drinking and eating chips and sa The oldest one, with his back to Azul, takes a sip from h mixed drink, then stands and excuses himself to the restr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Mean Dude walks into the first stall and sits dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three remaining Dudes notice Azul's guitar case. So d the Bartender. They all look at each other and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing and rolling  his eyes) What the hell is this, mariachi day?  There is no work for you here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul walks the mean Dude's table. Their laughing quiets d a bit as Azul stands before them. The Bartender stops smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender... one beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender nods and grabs a frosty glass. He begins to fill up at the tap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking at  him) In a bottle, wey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender stops filling the beer, stares at the half-full glass for a moment, then drinks the beer. Azul is staring at the three Mean Dudes. They stare back. The Bartender slaps the unopened bottle down at the count

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul doesn't pay attention to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for an old friend of  mine. His name is... Moco. Do you  know where I can find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can sometimes find him here. He  owns this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We work for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul turns to the mean Dude sitting to his left, and plac the guitar in his hands. The Mean Dude is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul opens the case and pulls out the MAC-10. The other t Mean Dudes are already reaching for their pistols. The Bartender ducks beneath the counter. Azul fires a million bullets into two of the Mean Dudes,  (the other is holding the case in shock). Their chests  explode, causing neat little dollops of flesh and blood f everywhere. The Mean Dude holding the guitar case is froz with fear. He manages to look up at Azul, who is watching the Mean Dudes die a slow, bloody death. The barrel of th MAC-10 is smoking. Azul turns slowly to the Mean Dude hol the case. Azul aims his MAC-10 in the Dude's face. Still  frozen holding the case, he spends his last moments looki down the gun's barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shots caused Old Mean Dude to peer out from his stall the toilet paper fell to the ground and started to roll a the floor. He now watches it roll as more shots ring out. pulls up his pants and walks toward the door slowly. He i sweating profusely. He slowly picks up the toilet paper,  plotting his next move. It grows silent... He takes a dee breath and rushes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Dude bursts into the room with a roll of toilet p in his hand, and a sheet of sweat sliding down his face. The Bartender rises up from behind the counter. The camera dollies slowly by the dead Dudes. Their blood- bathed faces twisted into odd shapes and expressions. The camera continues to dolly to the one dead Dude still hold the guitar case. His face is a bloody pulp. The camera st dollying to the old Dude's mixed drink. A hand is stirrin it with a straw. The camera pans up the arm to reveal Azu standing expressionless with his gun sling over his shoul Shot at 16fps the Old Dude quickly drops the toilet paper and runs back inside the bathroom. Azul turns to his guitar case and carefully chooses anoth weapon. He grabs the drink and tosses a napkin over his a like a waiter, then casually follows the Old Dude into th bathroom. The Bartenders glance at each other. One pours a shot gla full of tequila and raises it to his lips to drink it. Sh ring out and the Bartender spills the drink over himself. Without warning Azul bursts from the bathroom and walks c to his case. He replaces the weapon, picks up the case an leaves. A few seconds pass before the bartender grabs the phone a furiously dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Get me Moco!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open as Azul reenters, storming to the ba The Bartender is so petrified he doesn't think to drop th phone. Azul walks right up to the Bartender. The Bartender shuts his eyes. The sound of the beer bottl popping open can be heard, along with the sound of thirst guzzling. The Bartender opens his eyes to Azul. CLOSEUP of the empty bottle slamming to the counter. The Bartender glances down at the bottle. CLOSEUP of Azul tossing a few coins near the bottle as  payment. Azul leaves. A few seconds pass as the Bartender is standing there. Yo hear Moco yelling into the receiver asking what's going o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moco is on the porch trying to get the Bartender to answe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) WHAT'S GOING ON OVER THERE, ANSWER  ME!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear Moco's voice through the phone. The camera dolli into the Bartender as he screams into the receiver. The camera dollies in to the corpses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and finally a low outdoor frontal tracking shot of Azu walking away smiling as the image fades out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low angle of Hotel Coahuila sign. MEAN DUDE #5 enters the frame as his beeper goes off. He runs into the Hotel Coah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude #5 enters the lobby where an OLD CLERK is sitti at the counter reading a yellowed newspaper. There is a p bull on the floor beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da me telefono.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking) Take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude #5 grabs the phone and dials Moco's number. He  glances down at the PIT BULL lying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pit bull?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, pit bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line is picked up and Mean Dude talks into the phone. pulls out a piece of paper from his coat pocket and place it on the counter. He begins jotting down four names. He  then slowly crosses their names out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Viejo Clerk glances up from his paper. The Pit Bull a glances up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) All of them? How long ago? OK, What  does this guy look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clerk goes back to reading his paper. Pit Bull is still p attention, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same low-angle shot of the outdoor sign displaying the na Hotel Coahuila. Mariachi walks into frame, and pulls out wallet. Mariachi pulls out a few measly bucks then seems be considering what to do next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An inside shot looking out of the front glass reveals Mar looking at his wallet as Mean Dude talks to the phone. No one notices him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) ...carries a guitar case... And what  was he wearing?... all black...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pit Bull turns and looks out of the window. Seeing  Mariachi, he gets up and walks to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is putting his last few dollars back into his wa As he is walking away he notices the Pit Bull and he bend down for a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Don't worry, Moco. We'll find him,  and we'll mess him up real good. (ad lib)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low shot with long lens at full zoom of Mariachi tapping glass. CLOSEUP of dog responding. CLOSEUP of Mariachi tapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude hangs up the phone. He writes a few more things He turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracias se?or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he passes the camera you can see Mariachi still playin with the dog. Inside view CLOSEUP of Mariachi tapping on  glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Callate, hombre!!!

dialogues.speaker: SLOW MOTION SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Mariachi looks up at the Clerk, then stands. The Mean Dude turns around and looks and looks at the Cle Clerk turns to look at Mean Dude, who is walking back to counter. Mariachi picks his guitar from the ground. He is in full  view, but no one is looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viejo, if you see anyone new in town,  carrying a guitar case, dressed in  black... you can call this number,  OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude writes down a phone number and the description Azul on a little card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding sarcastically) And if I don't call, you'll kill  me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him the card) No. I won't kill you... he will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sarcastic smile fades from the old man. Mean Dude wal away. The old man reads the card, then glances out the wi Mariachi is gone.

dialogues.speaker: MARIACHI / MEAN DUDE
dialogues.text: Mariachi is turning a corner just as Mean Dude #5 exits t hotel. The Mean Dude walks off in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi enters Domino's bar. DOMINO is waiting on a few bums that are nursing their jaws. Mariachi sits with them asks for a refresco, He gets looks again. Domino serves h and he asks to see the owner. She says he's looking at th owner. He then asks her for work as a mariachi. She says has no money to pay him. He looks around the classy joint and knows she's lying (it turns out to be true, she has n money). When he asks how a girl can take care of herself a town like this she stuffs a gun barrel in his mouth. He nurses his jaw, pays and leaves, as the others laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MARIACHI CHECKS IN TO HOTEL
dialogues.text: Mariachi enters the run-down lobby of the motel. The Viej Clerk at the counter is reading his yellowed newspaper.  Mariachi sees the Pit Bull laying by the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pit bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, pit bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a cheap room for a week, and  I'd prefer to pay you in a few days,  after I've found some work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S?, later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Man hands Mariachi a key for the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mariachi walks away, the Clerk notices the guitar case and black clothes and he rereads the card Mean Dude left  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (different tone of  voice) Uh, excuse me se?or? I forgot, I  need a small deposit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi stops in his tracks. He turns back to the Clerk  slowly... thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking back slowly) You can trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very sorry, se?or. But... how  much can you spare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog is watching the event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) I've only got a few pesos... I plan  on finding work in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing money) Oh, that's enough for now, sir, thank  you and... enjoy your stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clerk deposits the money, slams the register shut, an continues reading his yellow paper. Confused, Mariachi po his empty wallet and turns to find his room. The Clerk pe over his paper, eyeing the guitar case as Mariachi goes. hears the sound of Mariachi's footsteps trailing off. The old man drops the paper and bolts silently to the phone a he dials El Moco's phone number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi opens his room, tosses his guitar onto the bed a hangs his jacket in the closet. He has only his white T-s underneath. He glances above the bed to a plaque bearing mace and two crossed swords. He checks out the shower and washes his face in the sink. He sits down on his bed. A f seconds later he drops back and lays there a minute befor kicking the door shut. He tries to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Clerk is talking on the phone to the bad guys. He hangs up the phone, then reaches into the back of his cou for a gun. He places it on the counter and covers it with his newspaper and continues reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top shot of Mariachi sleeping. A shot of the mace on the  wall.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM IN BOYSTOWN
dialogues.text: Mariachi is suddenly sleeping in the dirt. Same top shot in the hotel. He opens his eyes, then groggily he sits up ESTABLISHING SHOT of Mariachi sitting in the middle of a  ghost town. He stands up. VARIOUS SHOTS of the empty town with nothing and nobody. Medium shot dolly into Mariachi as he stands, turns and s a BOY bouncing a ball in slow motion. The Boy stops short holding the ball tight against the chest. Mariachi glance around to maybe spot more people, before concentrating on the Boy. The Boy places the ball carefully on the ground, then gen rolls it to Mariachi. Tracking shot of the ball rolling to Mariachi. The ball s like a speeding truck. Mariachi smiles at the boy. CLOSEUP of the ball rolling. CLOSEUP of the Boy smiling. Mariachi bends to get the ball which makes the sound of a screeching truck as it hits Mariachi's foot. Mariachi not that it's a man's severed head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi bolts up in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Dudes jump out of their truck and rush into the  hotel, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men burst into the lobby and the old men tells them t room number. They run out into the courtyard with the old man following. The Pit Bull is uninterested in the action

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Dudes run up the courtyard stairs and kick open first door they come to and start blasting into the room. Screams are heard. The men stand back, and finally look d the steps at the Viejo Clerk who is waving his arms  frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127!!! Cuarto 127, pendejos!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run to the room numbered 127 and cautiously stalk to it as they reload their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is sitting on his bed listening to all this. He  bolts to the restroom and turns to the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot of men still stalking, cocking pistols. POV shot of what men see, as camera nears the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi rushes out of the bathroom towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As camera nears the door, doorknob starts to move. Rememb that he never locked the door, he jumps to the side of th door as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men kick open the door and burst into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low-angle shot as men burst in. There is no one in the ro Mean Dude #5 hears the shower and motions to keep it down and stalk quietly... They rush into the bathroom and star blasting. Mariachi slips out from behind the door and runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi runs out of the room and jumps off the stairwell onto the courtyard in front of the Clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to his room) Cuidado, viejo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi darts out into the lobby. The old man watches hi go then turns his attention back to Mariachi's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing in Mariachi's  direction) Pendejos!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog watches as Mariachi tosses his keys into the cubb hole where they belong. Mariachi then jumps over the coun banging keys on the register to get it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Dudes run out of Mariachi's room, dart down the  stairs, passing the old man who is telling them where to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi, unable to open the register, jumps over the cou CLOSEUP of his feet as he lands, causing the register to  burst open. Mariachi turns for a second to ponder getting his money o risking dying, but then he checks to turn and run. Two se later the Mean Dudes run in, one jumps over the counter t see if he's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi runs atop the Mean Dudes' parked truck then jump into the bed of a passing truck. Mean Dudes run outside. Dudes have their hands up as if they don't know what to l for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears black!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shots of lots of people walking around, wearing black ite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck turns a corner and the driver halts, comes out  with a gun and tell Mariachi to get the hell out of his t Mariachi leaps out. He is about to continue running, but stops, clenches his fists, and turns slowly as the camera dollies into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera dollies into the guitar case on Mariachi's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi runs back in the direction of the hotel, but as turns the corner he has to slow down for the Mean Dudes a everywhere. Each one has his gun out and is looking aroun for the man in black. Mariachi walks slowly, whistling an nodding to everyone as they pass. A few look suspiciously him but continue searching. Mariachi ducks inside the hot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi enters the lobby and winks at the old Clerk who standing over his open register in shock. His eyes widen  when he sees Mariachi. He runs out of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming, pointing  inside) PENDEJOS!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi rushes in, grabs his jacket and puts it on. He g his guitar case and squeezes it tight, his eyes shut. Slo dolly into him, as his eyes open. CLOSEUP of plaque on wall with mace and swords. He grabs mace, swinging it around a few times. He feels secure, no He turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi rushes out the door, he looks down and sees the  Mean Dudes entering the courtyard. He ducks his head back just as they look up to see him. Mariachi runs up a small flight of steps, where he then tosses his guitar onto a  balcony, which he then jumps over to himself. The men rush up the steps shooting at the balcony. Bullet narrowly miss Mariachi as he climbs over the balcony to  safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi dashes down the hallway out onto a balcony. He s no way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Dudes are climbing over the balcony like spiders Mariachi runs back and slams his guitar into the first gu to make it over the balcony. His dummy falls down the sta and over the narrow railing. The Dude splats on the groun in gruesome CLOSEUP. The old man looks over at him as he dies, then turns back if nothing happened. Mariachi bolts back down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is looking down the balcony trying to find a way escape. Mariachi looks behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dudes barrel down the hallway reloading the guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi flings his mace over an electric cable, then sta on the balcony lip, placing his guitar between his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is sliding down the cable and turns back to see  Mean Dudes firing guns at him. Bus stops in traffic and  Mariachi grabs his guitar and jumps onto the hood of the  bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi jumps onto another car and then down into the st Mean Dudes exit the hotel and chase him on foot while a f get in the truck and chase him. The truck takes a short c Mariachi is running through the sidewalks and streets in  front of curioso shops, jumping small carts and children cars to escape the two men behind him. He enters a small  cutoff where the truck tries to stop him by heading off. bad guys stick their heads and guns out of their windows laugh as they ready to shoot him. Mariachi, though, alrea having built momentum, runs right up the front of the tru as the guys try to shoot him but not succeed in only shoo each other as he runs up and over the cab, into the bed, onto the street. He swings his guitar case into another g groin and grabs his gun, re-aiming it to shoot Mean Dude Mariachi shoots him in the arm, and Mean Dude #5 drops hi gun and cowers away in pain. Mariachi then turns the guy' gun on him and shoots him in the chest. Mariachi grabs hi case and as Mean Dude #5 turns to get s look at him, all sees is the case coming into his face. Mariachi heads bac for Domino's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi stumbles through city streets, pausing against a telephone pole as he gazes at Domino's Saloon across the  street. Mariachi stumbles across, almost getting hit by a few car and drags himself into the saloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi staggers into Amadeus and washes his face in a  fountain by the door. He makes his way to the bar as a pa pays and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you, Mariachi? Too  much refresco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just killed four guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino turns around and looks at Mariachi, wondering hard he's joking. He lifts up a bloody hand, grabs a napkin, a then seems to ask permission with his eyes before wiping hands clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi nods an ashamed yes. Domino reaches for her gun under the counter. The camera is on Mariachi when she brings it out and poin at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhausted) Wait a minute... what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, Domino! It was self- defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cocks the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) I'm new in town. I don't know  everyone!!! I have no friends here...  and no enemies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering the gun a  bit) Thieves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) No way. They were well-dressed men.  I checked into the cheapest hotel in  town, no money, nothing of value,  except this guitar and maybe this  coat, which they could have taken  when I left my room, but they didn't.  They were only interested in killing  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifting the gun back  up) So why do you come here? You want to  get me killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a place to stay until I figure  this out. They've got me mixed up  with someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've never seen them before?  Not even in another town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long pause) Are you saying they followed me, a  mariachi, here? What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they hate your music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi stares at her expressionless. She stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you were singing in another  town, they hated your voice, and now  they're trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to help me, or am I  gonna have to die on your porch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a room upstairs. My room.  Don't touch anything. I'll be up  after awhile and we can call a friend  of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi shakes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'll never forget this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to kiss her hand. She slides it away and effortl slaps him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows her to a doorway revealing an unlit staircase. When he enters, the darkness swallows him as she shuts th door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi enters a roomy, luxurious apartment above the ma bar. There is a free-standing porcelain tub in the center the room. Mariachi places his guitar halfway between the  entrance and the tub. The camera is tracking backwards wi him as he walks, making the room look endless. He removes his jacket as he makes his way to the tub. He drops his j onto the floor and gently climbs into the tub. The camera faces him as he settles back. The camera slowly dollies i him as he lays back, crosses his fingers, and gives a rel smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino is washing a glass. She then remembers she has the gun in her waist belt, so she removes it and sticks it ba under the counter. Wounded Mean Dude #5 comes in limping. She takes out a towel and drops it on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Domino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the phone. I have to call  Moco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brings up the phone and sets it down where the cloth  was. He picks up the cloth and wraps his arm with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not as bad as it looks. Domino,  has anyone come through here? A  stranger, maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a border town. I get strangers  all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed all in black, carrying a  guitar case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he shot me... and has killed  ten of Moco's men... all in one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino looks a little upset. She slides the phone towards him a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you gonna call your boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) I have to tell Moco that he got away  again... So, you better give me a  drink first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino smiles and pours him half a beer mug with tequila. laughs and drinks. As he's dialing, the camera is on Domi as she cleans up a few things, every once in a while glan upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Moco, he got away. Shot me in the  arm. Killed La Palma. Pepino, Sunday.  This guy is one slick maricon. Yeah.  Also, I didn't get a look at him.  So, unless he's still carrying that  guitar around and hasn't changed  clothes, I won't even spot him, and  I don't think he'll be that obvious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. If there's one thing I  know, it's that he'll always wear  black and he'll always carry that  guitar with him. It's his signature.  Besides, that's not a guitar he's  carrying. It's a guitar case full of  weapons. Find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude hangs up and puts his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Que paso?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I screwed up. The guy left his guitar  case in the hotel room. We chased  him out, but he came back for the  case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he loves his guitar. It's  probably an antique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a guitar. It was a guitar  case full of weapons that he uses on  his victims. Adios, I'm gonna take a  nap. And thanks for the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude #5 stumbles as he tries to stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you see this guy, call us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is about to walk off with the bloody towel and he turn back pointing at it. She waves her hand at him, as if gra him permission to take it. She cleans his glass, and when is gone she slams the glass down and runs for the stairs. few seconds later she comes back into the bar, grabs the from under the counter and calls her assistant to watch t bar. He sees the gun and wonders what she's up to. She st upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino opens the door abruptly and finds Mariachi taking bath. He bolts upright, pulls a towel up from the floor a sits frozen waiting for Domino's next move. She laughs an walks to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) I thought I told you not to touch  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I needed to relax. I can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) No, it's alright, Finish up. Do you  want shampoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laying back, closed  eyes) Yes, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino turns to a counter and her smile fades. She looks  like she wants to rip Mariachi's throat out with her teet She puts the gun down on the counter. She finds an ominou looking knife and then grabs a bottle of shampoo. She wal over to him, then pulls the knife up to his throat with o hand while grabbing his hair with the other. He opens his eyes wide. The shampoo hits the floor and begins to roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choking) I'm a musician!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shampoo bottle rolls into the guitar case and stops.  Domino sees this, and with her foot reaches out and pulls the case toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have in here? GUNS?  KNIVES?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi tries to catch his breath, pausing before answer her as if wondering if all this is really happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! My guitar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino slides her foot out of her shoe, and unsnaps one o the latches with her toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unsnaps another. The latches snap loud and echo in th quiet room. Mariachi gasps as she tightens her grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very modest, Mariachi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She squeezes his hair and unsnaps another latch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through gritted teeth) You told me you killed four men,  when you really killed seven. Or  were they still breathing even you  shot out their hearts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another latch snaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing dizzy) I'm a mariachi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...not a murderer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts the lid with her foot. It seems an eternity bef the case is fully open. Domino is looking into the case, Mariachi is not. He knows what's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you... I am a musician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow dolly into the case, which contains a white, well-ke classical guitar. Domino is seeing it, and for a moment s almost believes he is telling the truth. She rushes to it, grabs the guitar and tosses it to Maria He catches it, choking after she releases the blade. She on the other side of the tub, now. She jams the knife dow between Mariachi's legs. Mariachi's eyes bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still choking) W... w... what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino shoves the knife in deeper and Mariachi grimaces  horribly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play it, damnit, play something  sweet!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is sweating and his face is extremely red. He pa for a long time before plucking an odd note. She squints if she's caught him. But he eventually starts picking out sweet little melody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing impatient) SING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi starts to sing but chokes on the words. He start over, playing a "Rancho Grande" sounding song with his ow made up words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a high sweet voice) What is this place? That treats me  like a murderer? They've all got  their heads up their butts... Even  this beautiful girl, With a knife to  my balls, Should I kiss her or hit  her... Or both?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes his song, bowing and thanking his imaginary  audience. Domino is smiling. She pulls the knife slowly o of the water and wipes it off on her apron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a mariachi, all right. And a  good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi bows a solemn thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is the best I've ever  played. You... inspired me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of the knife. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hire me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino looks at him with a silent "what?".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. Hire me to play in your  bar. I'll work mostly from tips.  But, I need steady work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't pay you. I have no money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fancy place and you have no  money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll work for room and board, then.  Please, I'm desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) Will I have to keep a knife at your  balls to get you to play like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Not if you're paying me room and  board. Please... until I find a  permanent job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) You won't find a permanent job in  this town... but OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up slowly, and turns to leave. Mariachi settles  back, smiling triumphantly. Suddenly she darts around and slams the knife between his legs again with a furious loo on her face. He bolts up out of this triumphant daze with look of complete shock. She loosens up and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to need a better sense  of humor than that, if you're gonna  work for me, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flings her knife aside. It sticks into a wall. She sh smiles a beautiful smile, turns, and goes downstairs. Mar settles back down, closing his eyes. The knife slips out the wall and clangs to the ground. Mariachi jumps again,  rolls his eyes, and sinks underwater as the picture fades

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi plays in Amadeus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera tracks past a pool table where TWO RATS are playin nine ball. They make a few shots, then the phone rings. T camera continues to track past a small table where Azul's guitar case lies open. Weapons adorn it, with each knife, each gun in its pocket, in its own place. The camera cont tracking to a dresser on which sits Azul's cellular phone delicate female hand lifts the receiver. The camera is no positioned above the bed as the GIRL answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes? One moment please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls over and wakes a GIRL sleeping beside her. Girl takes the phone and passes it to a third GIRL as Girl #2  tries to wake Azul (he is sleeping between Girls #2 and # Girl #3 has the phone to her ear as if listening for  background conversation. The two Rats playing pool are staring longingly at the th Girls in Azul's bed. They look hungry and deprived. One h the other, signaling it's his shot. While one shoots, the other watches. Azul awakens and grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moco is sitting in his pool. A swimming WAITER is bringin him drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Amigo! I'm glad I've reached you!  You've not answered all day. Killing  ten of my men must have been very  time consuming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I've only killed six! You were always  bad at maths, Moco. I guess that's  why you never paid me half of the  money. You thought it all belonged  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I knew half was yours... I got greedy,  my friend. It's my nature. But you!!!  You are modest! You've killed ten of  my men!! I know, because I'm having  them buried in my yard right now.  With my dogs and cats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (counting on his  fingers, into phone) I killed six. But don't bother  counting so soon. The number will  triple by tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I'm sorry things turned out this  way. My friend. I got greedy. I should  never have tried to kill you. It  would have been cheaper for me to  pay you. Now I've got to find ten  new men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I tell you what. You give me my money,  and I won't kill any more of your  men... And I won't kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a sip, into  phone) No, it's too late for that. We're  going to have to see this through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Just like the Moco I used to know.  Still wearing white?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down at his  clothes, into phone) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I think you should change clothes.  I'd hate to ruin a white suit with  your stupid blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul hangs up. He gets dressed and leaves. The little Rat are about to follow, but one Rat walks over to get one lo at the girls. The girls tease him, and when he tries to  advance them, they pull guns and laugh as the Rat runs aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino walks by with a trash can. Mariachi is sitting on barstool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to get my money back from  that hotel. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? If you go anywhere  with that jacket and that case you  could be killed. Leave that stuff  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi gets up and is about to get his guitar case from under the stool. Mariachi leaves it under the stool and takes off the jack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never go anywhere without it. Take  care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi leaves. Domino drops the trash can and tells her assistant to watch the bar. She heads for the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino walks out onto her balcony, peering down into the  street. POV shot of Mariachi walking through the street. Domino turns and walks to the phone. She dials a number b heart and sits in a plush chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moco answers the phone. Towel around his neck, wet hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dolly in slow, into  phone) Hi. It's Domino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I know who it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolly into Moco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clerk is reading a paper. He hears a noise and pulls aside. Mariachi is standing at the counter smiling. The C jumps in his seat, then after a few frozen seconds he set down his paper and reaches for Mariachi's old room key. Mariachi shakes his head "no", points to the register, an makes the money sign with his hand. The Clerk slowly move over to the register. He depresses a few keys to open it. won't open. He makes a gesture like it's stuck or somethi (he is not very convincing). He tries again and again; ea time pretending to get more impatient. Mariachi glances d at the Pit Bull. The Pit Bull is eyeing Mariachi. Mariach points to the Clerk as if he has an inside joke with the ("this guy..."). Mariachi climbs over the counter and sta next to the Clerk. The Clerk thinks Mariachi is a lunatic Mariachi holds up a finger as if cueing the Clerk for a  demonstration. Mariachi then leaps over the counter landi firmly back on the other side of the counter. CLOSEUP of his feet landing hard, just as before. The register opens. Mariachi shrugs, smiles, and reaches  into the register, taking his money out himself. He count it. After a brief consideration, he decides to leave the man a tip. Mariachi waves a "good-bye" wave and dances ou The old man, still standing there with his arms outstretc as if he was robbed, dashes to the phone and calls Moco's men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar Assistant is cleaning the bar. He walks over to g a few glasses and when he returns, Azul is sitting at the barstool Mariachi was on earlier. The Assistant looks aro wondering where Azul appeared from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get something to drink or eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Assistant grabs a mug and starts to fill it at the ta He fills it halfway when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a bottle, wey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a bottle and hands it to Azul, then lifts the mu toasts and drinks it straight down. Azul drinks his straight down, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Isn't there a girl that works here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she owns the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading a few bills  to the Assistant) She owns it, now? Then she is Moco's  girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) So-so. She's onto this new musician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul takes out a few more bills and hands them to the  Assistant, and begins to stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is out on the streets, returning to Domino's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he crosses the street he notices Azul leaving the salo with a guitar case. Mariachi runs into the saloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi runs inside and checks to see if his case is sti there. Domino comes downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saw a guy with a guitar case  like mine. It's him they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Assistant) Did he say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) No, he just ordered a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't look anything like him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul is walking to his truck when he turns to a corner an Mean Dude #4 sticks his gun in his face. Two more guns ap pointed at the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Rats are in the blue truck half a block away. One hits the other to look at what's happening to Azul. POV of Rats seeing Azul with three guys around him with g They look at each other, start the truck and speed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? You're one of those old-time  mariachis, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, let's take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude #4 takes the case and lays it flat in Azul's pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's a guitar like you say it is,  we'll never bother you again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude #4 unsnaps two of the latches, SNAP... SNAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unsnaps three more... SNAP... SNAP... SNAP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then we'll spray paint this street  with your brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points the gun deep into Azul's face and cocks it. Azu closes his eyes. Mean Dude #5 lifts the lid. Azul hears a faint strumming sound, followed by the sound of the Mean  Dude slamming the case shut. Azul opens his eyes. The Mea Dude resnaps the latches. SNAP... SNAP... SNAP-SNAP-SNAP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking away) Sorry....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk away leaving Azul wondering what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino, Mariachi, and Assistant are standing at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, as long as you don't carry the  case around, they'll leave you alone.  It's that guy they're after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting on his coat) I better put this upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the case and begins to take it to the stairs, bu he pauses for it feels different to him. He slowly looks  down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul watches the Mean Dudes go and when they turn the cor he puts the case on the ground to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Dudes are rounding the corner, but Mean Dude #5, who is last, snaps his fingers and motions to the others keep quiet and to watch Azul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi shakes the case, and puts it on the counter as i to open it... but he doesn't need to check it. He knows i not his guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi looks at her startled, then runs out of the bar  with the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dudes are watching Azul unsnap his case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul opens the lid, revealing Mariachi's guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Dudes start walking towards Azul as the camera t back with them. Azul slams the case shut, wondering what hell is going on. He looks up and notices the Mean Dudes  walking towards him. He stands up and slowly walks in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is running through the streets and onto the side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bad guys are pulling out their weapons. Mariachi bolts around the corner. Now everyone is on the  same sidewalk. Mariachi and Azul are on each end of the s with the Mean Dudes in between them. Azul turns and sees Mariachi with his guitar case. Mean D #5 turns and sees Mariachi, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two other Mean Dudes exchange glances. Mean Dude #5 s after Mariachi, so the other two follow. Mariachi looks t Azul for help. Azul tips the imaginary hat to Mariachi an walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi runs through the street almost getting hit. Bull are flying as the Mean Dudes are firing at him as they ru

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DEAD END
dialogues.text: Mariachi leaps up over a few cars and ends up in a dead e He turns around, drops the case on the ground and opens i A million weapons seem to stare back at him when he opens it. He is frantic. He grabs a small gun, shakes it in his hand, doesn't like the feel. He tosses it back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Dudes are barreling down the street. One turns  towards the dead end.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DEAD END
dialogues.text: Mariachi pulls out the MAC-10 and blasts the first Mean D he sees. He grabs the case and runs out into the street,  jumping onto a truck and blasting the other Mean Dude fro up there. He sees Mean Dude #5 run away. Mariachi comes off the truck and walks through the street in slow motion. People are staring at him as if he was Az the killer. Mariachi walks straight to the bar. A BOY is  bouncing a ball on one of the sidewalks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera dollies past the vacant pool table, and over t Rat sitting in a chair, drinking a beer. The other Rat is pacing back and forth in front of the sitting Rat. Azul e the room. Throwing his guitar case onto the pool table as grand entrance gesture. The sitting Rat stands beside the pacing Rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry we left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We didn't know what to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We figured you could defend  yourself!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rat #2 nods in agreement. Azul unsnaps one of the latches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought I could defend myself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...against three armed men...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...using this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the case and the guitar sparkles at them. The Ra exchange glances. They look at the guitar then back at Az

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My case got switched with some maricon  mariachi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is this mariachi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead by now... So, I want you  to go look for my case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Rats are about to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Rats take out their guns. Azul takes Rat #2's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was disloyal of you to leave me  out there. You should be as loyal to  me as you are to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rats exchange glances, then aim their eyes back to th floor. Azul turns to Rat #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you loyal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after glancing at  Rat #1) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rat #1) Are you loyal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul gestures to Rat #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rat #1 turns to Rat #2 who is in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are loyal, are you not? SHOOT  HIM. Or I shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul aims his gun at Rat #1, who immediately aims his gun Rat #2. Rat #2 is sweating bullets. Rat #1 puts his gun d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said we should be as loyal to  you as we are to each other. I  couldn't shoot him, for that would  be as disloyal as shooting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rat #2 glances back and forth between Rat #1 and Azul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. Now go find my case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul puts his gun down and motions the rats to leave. The leave. When they exit, Rat #1 turns to Rat #2 and snaps h fingers. Rat #2 shakes his hand. They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino is dabbing hydrogen peroxide onto a cotton swab. S applies it to Mariachi's body scars on his back. Mariachi has his eyes closed. He washes the blood from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you when he came into the  bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was on the phone, talking to a  friend that knows what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you mention me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... He told me the man in black is  Azul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If his name is Azul, why doesn't he  wear blue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Anyway, he's killing  the men of the town drug dealer. The  dealer's name is Mauricio. But he's  known as Moco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Moco is sending these men to  find Azul. So, why do they chase me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have never seen Azul... only  Moco knows him. My friend says the  description Moco gave his men was  that he wears black, and carries a  guitar case. Sounds like you, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't you tell your friend that  there are two people like that in  his town? One is a killer, and one  is a mariachi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only special people can talk to Moco.  Besides, you've killed a few of his  men, now. Your best option is to  keep out of sight, stop wearing black,  and to hide that stupid case until  this is all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude #5 comes in and approaches Moco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got away... but I got a good look  at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moco takes out a cigarette and puts it in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coca, Caca, Beto were killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moco takes out a match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't get away again, Moco. I  promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moco lights his match across Mean Dude #5's face and ligh his cigarette. Mean Dude #5 walks away, as Moco flicks hi match at him in slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is about to lay on the floor. She tosses him a  blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you always closed Monday nights,  or did you close since I can't play  my guitar tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mondays are my day off. Want to play  a game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. Domino gets up to answer it. Mariachi re under his blanket for a small mirror and combs his hair,  putting spit in his hair to slick it down. He quickly sta the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Come see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moco is sitting at a table playing cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I don't feel well. I've got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Have you ridden the bike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) No... I've got to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet as if thinking) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't figure out something. You  tell me you're poor. Poor family.  Yet you've got this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing) This place is a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Mauricio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From EL MOCO? The man trying to kill  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not trying to kill you, his man  had you confused with Azul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you know how if you want to  impress a girl, you send her flowers,  candy, jewelry until you win her  love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If one present doesn't work, you  keep sending bigger and better things  until you win her or you're broke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mauricio sent me flowers, then  jewelry, then he gave me a job at  his saloon, then he gave me the whole  saloon... etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still giving you things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never run out of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you accept it all? What's the  last thing he sent you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino walks over to the counter and picks up a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants me to ride out to his ranch  when I've decided to be his. He thinks  he's close to having me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) He was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits next to Mariachi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss. She gets up and is about to turn off the light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you really are from a poor family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the dark) I remember when I was growing up, we  were so poor, that my brothers and  sisters and I all slept on the same  blanket stretched out across the  floor. We had to sleep in a circle,  with our fingers in each other's  ears, to keep the bugs from crawling  into them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) Ay, wey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino hands Mariachi a wad of money. Mariachi sees the money and looks up at her bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a little bit I've saved. I  want you to go get a new guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi starts to put up his hand as if to refuse it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it, stupid. I'm not saying go  by the best one, just a temporary  one so you can play again tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi stops and thinks... He looks up at her questioni then he shrugs an "OK" and grabs the money and jogs out  excitedly. Domino is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi walks down the sidewalk, passing curioso shops. camera is low and zoomed in all the way. Mariachi stops b one of the window that has a guitar in the glass. He pull his money and counts it. He stops after he notices someon reflection in the window. He turns around and sees it is  Mean Dude #5 right across the street. He meets up with an Mean Dude. They are standing right behind Mariachi. Maria is pretending to still look at the window. The Mean Dudes walk past Mariachi so Mariachi walks in the opposite  direction. Mean Dude #5 stops and then turns around slowl Far zoomed shot of Mariachi walking down the street with  guys behind him. They start after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking shot following Mariachi. Tracking shot in front of Mean Dudes walking at Mariachi. Mean Dude #5 pulls out a small walkie-talkie and calls hi buddy in the truck a block away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) Loco, he's headed your way... black  pants, white shirt.

dialogues.speaker: IN A TRUCK DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: LOCO starts the truck and starts driving slowly across th street. As he turns on the corner, Mariachi sees the truc and casually climbs inside and hides in the back. Mean Du #5 turns the corner when whispers into walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) Where did he go, Loco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, into walkie- talkie) He got in my truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude #5 laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) Take him around the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean Dude #5 taps his buddy and they start running down t block. Mariachi is in back the truck searching for a weapon. The truck stops. Mariachi rolls to the side and gently lifts head. POV Mariachi sees the two Mean Dudes walking at him. Mari turns and Loco is there to knock him in the face with the rifle butt. Mariachi falls into truck, blood trickling fr his dizzying head. He tries to get up a bit, but Loco is the truck now, and slams the rifle down into his face har Blackout.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY ROAD TO MOCO'S
dialogues.text: Mariachi is unconscious in the back of Loco's truck. Mean Dude #5 and other Mean Dudes are riding in back with Mari

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The above scene intercuts back and forth with the arrival Loco. Loco arrives at the gate, Mean Dude #5 opens the ga they drive through. The truck is facing Moco so he can't Mariachi yet. Mean Dude #5 closes the gate and walks over the truck, opens the back door, and calls Moco over. Moco walks over to the truck and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is laying there unconscious, Moco puts his arm a Mean Dude #5, who is looking very proud, and Moco pulls o a cigarette and a match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moco strikes the match behind Mean Dude #5's head. Mean D #5 stops smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino is waiting on customers. She glances at her watch. few seconds later she glances at it again. She looks very worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul's Rats burst into the hideout. FOUR GIRLS pop up ove the partition with guns. The Rats stop in their tracks. T girls sigh a "oh, it's them" sigh and slink back to bed. shot of them trying to wake Azul. Azul wakes up and looks over the partition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard they caught you and were  taking you to Moco's ranch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so we came to see if it was true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul thinks a moment. He stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They caught the mariachi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul dresses, smiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariachi is in a holding cell at the ranch. He twitches,  finally waking up. He sees a GUARD outside and finds a way to escape. He grabs the guard's assault rifle and turns a corner. Tw men grab him. He slams the butt of the rifle, knocking th wind and teeth out of BAD GUY #1, then he kicks down and  breaks the shin bone of BAD GUY #2 who screams out in ago Mariachi silences him by karate punching his throat. The Guy gurgles and hits the ground. Angle from the ground as Mariachi smashes the guy with is gun. He crawls up a wall, trying to escape as quietly as he ca He sees TWO MORE MEN running towards him since they heard some noise. Mariachi aims his assault rifle at the blue C parked behind him. He fires and it explodes. Mariachi jumps Loco, gets him to drive him to the saloon. also takes Loco's money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul walks into frame, looks around then proceeds into th bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azul goes inside and finds Domino tending the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a bottle and slams it down on the counter unope He eyes her admirably and then pops the top with one hand He guzzles the drink, slamming it down empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) My guitar case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mariachi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
